jade.core.security

Class SecurityHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • jade.core.security.SecurityHelper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    jade.core.ServiceHelper, jade.security.CredentialsHelper

    public class SecurityHelper
extends java.lang.Object
implements jade.core.ServiceHelper, jade.security.CredentialsHelper
    This class provides an agent all methods for accessing security functionalities. Usually each agent has a SecurityHelper object accessible through the getHelper() method of the Agent class.
    Version:
    $Date: 2007-04-24 16:20:28 +0200 (mar, 24 apr 2007) $ $Revision: 1001 $
    Author:
    Giosue Vitaglione - Telecom Italia Lab, Nicolas Lhuillier - Motorola, Jerome Picault - Motorola

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(jade.core.Agent a)
        This must be called in order to initialize the SecurityHelper. Configuration parameters are read from the profile.
        Specified by:
        init in interface jade.core.ServiceHelper

      • getUseSignature

        public boolean getUseSignature(jade.lang.acl.ACLMessage msg)
        Tells if a message has been set with setUseSignature, or if an incoming message has been signed by the sender. Note that if the incoming message was signed then it also means the signature is valid.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to be checked for signature
        Returns:
        true if message has been signed, false otherwise

      • setUseSignature

        public void setUseSignature(jade.lang.acl.ACLMessage msg)
        Sets the message to be signed

      • getUseEncryption

      • setSymmetricAlgorithm

        public void setSymmetricAlgorithm(java.lang.String a)
        Sets the algorithm to be used for symmetric encryption and decryption. Examples of valid transformations are: - "DES" - "AES" - "PBEWithMD5AndDES" - "DES/ECB/PKCS5Padding"

      • getSymmetricAlgorithm

        public java.lang.String getSymmetricAlgorithm()
        Returns the algorithm currently set for symmetric encryption/decription.

      • setKeySize

        public void setKeySize(int s)
        Sets the strength of the symmetric encryption key. Note: this must be compliant with the symmetric algorithm
        See Also:
        setSymmetricAlgorithm

      • getPrincipal

        public jade.security.JADEPrincipal getPrincipal(jade.lang.acl.ACLMessage msg)
        If the ACLMessage is signed, this method returns the signer's principal contained in the envelope of the message. Ohterwise it returns null.
        Specified by:
        getPrincipal in interface jade.security.CredentialsHelper

      • getCredentials

        public jade.security.Credentials getCredentials(jade.lang.acl.ACLMessage msg)
                                         throws jade.security.JADESecurityException
        The set of credentials attached to the ACL Message are extracted from the :X-credential slot and returned. If not credentials were attached, this method returns null.
        Specified by:
        getCredentials in interface jade.security.CredentialsHelper
        Throws:
        jade.security.JADESecurityException

      • addCredentials

        public void addCredentials(jade.lang.acl.ACLMessage msg,
                           jade.security.Credentials cred)
                    throws jade.security.JADESecurityException
        Attach credentials to the :X-credential slot of this ACLMessage. Developers shall pay attention that if the ACL Message already contained credentials, these will be replaced by the new ones
        Throws:
        jade.security.JADESecurityException
